185964463.review: Eigentlich sehr gut schön wäre noch eine bessere Anleitung.

185881965.review:
Un juego que no necesita diálogos densos ni mucha complejidad en su gameplay.

Hob es un juego de aventuras/plataformas que debes ir avanzando resolviendo puzzles. No tiene mucha complejidad, perfectamente es como un mario u otro título que conozcas.

Ahora bien:
Estéticamente me parece hermoso, nada más que añadir su señoría.
Su soundtrack aunque no lo siento tan memorable está lindo.
La historia te la va contando el propio juego, no necesitas ser un genio para entender el trasfondo del mundo.

¿Lo recomiendo? con estas 2.5hs que llevo jugandolo te diré que si. Juegalo como lo que es: un juego que te va a relajar y te va a entretener un montón.

<3

185600881.review: Great game simple fun puzzler, liked the atmosphere and the plot at the end , enigmatic story but great one

185548793.review: Pretty neat little Zelda clone. Graphics are better than what the screenshots make it appear, but need to make sure to calibrate the gamma so the colors are saturated. Like the atmosphere and quiet soundscape, very peaceful world. Combat is no sweat and neither are the puzzles. Just a sublime adventure.

185474262.review: Love the game, the enviromental puzzles and level designs are amazing, although I found myself getting lost quite a few times, mostly due to the game not being clear on where I could and couldn't jump. I loved how the same environment shifted and changed while I progressed in the game. I encountered quite a few bugs but considering the studio shut down I don't feel like complaining much. Wish the story was clearer as my going around did not feel as meaningful as I hoped except for the ending. I like non verbal story telling but this was brought to an extreme, having some visuals to explain the protagonist purpose would have helped; you can make out the story thanks to the enviromental storytelling but I feel as if it's not enough. Atmosphere and graphic are splendid, very nicely done and the concept art is even prettier. If you can get your hands on the game while it's on sale (due to bugs and lack of polishing I can't recomend it at full price) please do as it is a nice experience and it's not too long. :7

185186379.review:
This is almost a good game, but it's flaws add up to something I'd just as soon have not played. Minimalism is all well and good when done properly, but in this case it just winds up being a very thin experience. Combat is extremely basic, mostly perfunctory. Very few different enemy types, all with predictable attack patterns. Lots of sitting around waiting for an opening. Some of them are real damage sponges too, especially if you don't find all the sword upgrades.

Admittedly combat is not the main focus of the game, but the trend of overall "thin"-ness extends to the puzzles, the artwork, and the story. This game has puzzles in the same way that putting together IKEA furniture is a puzzle; it's obfuscated some by the level design, but the entire game boils down to "push button, open path to next button." I'll admit the art/graphics of this game are solid, but again they wear on you by the end. There's essentially one biome in this game so it all looks same-y; expect to see similar sweeping vistas over and over.

Lastly, the game lacks polish on a technical level that leads to a fair bit of frustration. Fixed camera angle + platforming = lots of falling that doesn't feel like your fault, leading to deaths or repeating tedious climbs until you happen to get it right. It's also fairly easy to get your character stuck in the scenery, forcing a respawn and losing progress. 

Overall not the worst game I've played by any stretch, but all of its flaws add up to something I'd just as soon have never played.

185180425.review: The story dosent exist. A platform game. But! it can be played!

185155709.review: 很容易让我联想到《大鹫》，同样是解谜、童话风格、低指引。如果你能对上制作者的电波，那你会很喜欢这款游戏。一个接一个的谜题会让你根本停不下来。整个流程下来就是哎？这边走看一看？哎有个奖励，那边再走一走？哎又有个奖励。不过BUG也挺多，而且BGM差了点意思，只有在观赏点的时候才会好点

185093620.review: This game is the definition of a hidden gem, everyone should know about for all kinds of reasons and yet if is completely forgotten. For it has an absolutely gorgeous cell shaded art style and pretty much everything looks incredible. It is essentially a 3D metroitvania, a 3D plarformer, a puzzle game and it even has some sweet combat. The result is a beautiful adventure that is in many ways one of a kind.

185090975.review:
Graphiquement, rien à redire, c'est beau, et les différents biomes font plaisir aux yeux. 
La BO est assez oubliable cela dit, elle place une atmosphère dont on se lasse vite parce que très peu diversifiée.

L'exploration, assez fluide initialement, devient un prétexte sur le long terme pour faire gagner de l'espérance de vie au jeu, par des mécanismes de collectibles planqués ici et là avec des voies d'accès hyper précises que vous galérerez probablement à trouver. 

Et tout ça est porté par une histoire très peu élaborée, et très peu originale qui plus est. Ces différents éléments en font un jeu finalement très moyen, que l'on est soulagé de finir en bout de course.

184589803.review:
This game is very pretty, but also rather buggy.  While in combat, you can trigger cut scenes, which doesn't stop the enemies from attacking you.  While trying to trigger cut scenes, there is a decent chance that the game thinks you want to attack.  Sometimes you will be able to jump down off a ledge, and other times you can't jump down if your life depended on it because you keep grabbing the ledge and pulling yourself back up.  Sometimes ladders just let you clip through them instead of you climbing them.  Most of the time to climb ladders you point up on the analog stick.  Sometimes you don't,  you have to point left or right. 
 Sometimes the giant fish swim over the land instead of only in the water.  There are places in the water that you can't actually get out of because the only path out is being blocked by invisible water currents, which just soft locks you (thankfully there is a respawn option in the menu, I couldn't even get to anything to kill me so I could skeleport)

I really wanted to like this game, but it is so frustratingly inconsistent and buggy and honestly it seems to only get worse the more hours I put into the game.  Reached a point that the annoyance outweighs the joy of playing

184439228.review:
Good game
Could be a bit more polished but gameplay is fine and entertaining

184378757.review:
A lovely game about exploring the ruins of a world and restoring it to a semblance of its former glory. 

I thoroughly enjoyed it. The visuals were fantastic (the wildlife in particular was strange and wonderful), and the play rewarding as you develop mastery of both the character and your understanding of the world.

My only nit was that one ability [spoiler](the grapple)[/spoiler] was a little janky when platforming, but this didn't meaningfully affect the overall experience.

Overall: fantastic, highly recommended if the visuals appeal to you and if you like platformers.

184260992.review: Liebevoll gestaltetes Spiel. Sehr viel zu entdecken. Schöne Rätsel. Leider manchmal ein paar Bugs im Spiel.

184153548.review:
Here we go, the last review of 2024.

I'm kind of late to the party, but better late than never. This game was the third and the last game from Runic Games before they got shut down by their parent company Perfect World Entertainment (Now known as Arc Games). To me, this game felt like a swansong to a great company who made Torchlight 1 and 2, one of the greatest diablo clones to be made to this day. It was released only a few months before Runic closed it's doors.

Unlike Torchlight series, this game is not a diablo clone, but the gameplay is more inspired by SNES/Gameboy Zelda games, which would make this as an Action Adventure game. There's no dialogue, no talking, the entire story of this game is visual only. You are left to figure out the lore on your own. 

The graphics still hold up, even to this day. The visuals, the scenery, how everything changes around you and the background makes this game very unique. It has sort of a nature/ancient techno style to it. I like it, it's really unique, especially love the scenes where you raise certain platforms to unlock new areas.

Gameplay: It's basically Zelda gameplay, lot of swishing the sword, not very complicated combat. You have some other abilities you unlock as you progress and some upgrades you can buy from the green orbs you get from either defeated enemies or treasure pillars. There are also life, energy and sword upgrades throughout the game. What I also like about progression in this game is if you go into a dungeon, it tells you what collectibles you have collected and what else is missing, so you know you don't have to check the dungeon for hours to see if you missed something.

Music is so so. It's okay.

Only negative thing is there are some bugs which causes you to get stuck or die. Luckily if you do get stuck, you have the option to respawn to the nearest checkpoint. If you are aiming for 100% achievement though, this might be a problem, since one of the achievements requires you to play the entire game with less than 5 deaths. Could be possible through some cheesing. 

Overall, for a farewell game, it's pretty good. Thank you Runic Games, God bless you.

184038354.review: Последняя игра Runic Games перед закрытием ,которая сделала прекрасна и с душой. Сюжет начинающийся со страницы комикса на сайте закончивающий спасение мира от заражения или как говорил ваас безумие это поворот одного и того же действия. Сложный платформер с хорошей боевкой. Не сыскавший большой популярности(

184036658.review:
Not a bad game necessarily, but I certainly wouldn't call it good either.

I get the inspiration. It's blending the design of Zelda: A Link to the Past with the ideology of Journey. In other words, Hob is a Zelda-like that seeks to tell its story and setting all without any dialogue. Unfortunately, it fails to meet any strides of both inspirations. It lacks the emotional beats of Journey and the design sense of Zelda.

It looks very pretty, and the idea of literally piecing the world together through your actions is a really neat idea. But the lack of dialogue or any words prevents me from knowing or caring about anything that's going on. What is Hob btw? Your guess is as good as mine, and I beat the game! Is Hob the world? Is the player character called Hob? Is the parasitic... thing infecting the world called Hob? We don't know.

And without any labels or map sectors, the game lacks any landmarks to be able to follow its world properly. I swear I had to make leaps of faith in order to progress in places it doesn't seem like I should have.

The combat is actually really solid, and again it does look very pretty. But as a Zelda-like, it can only be described as very generic and uninteresting.

184008626.review:
Неплохо продуманная метроидвания в довольно приятном, самобытном мире, с упором на исследование и решение головоломок. Этой фразой, в принципе, я мог бы и ограничить свой обзор, если бы не два критичных недостатка, о которых невозможно не упомянуть.
Первое — баги. То игра крашнется, то анимация криво отобразится, то какие-нибудь другие визуальные глитчи, то враг телепортнётся, то после выхода из игры окажется, что последнее сохранение не прошло, то вы провалитесь под пол или получите ваншот от прикосновения к кактусу... Каждая отдельная проблема может проявиться лишь 1-2 раза за всю игру, но вот этих вот таких разных мелочей может повстречаться так много, что они начинают подбешивать ещё в первую половину прохождения.
Второе — боевая система. Она отвратительна, из-за тупизны врагов и кривых таймингов. Быстрый удар гигантской дубиной от здорового бугая на ранних этапах может ваншотнуть вас, и хотя в игре есть блок и уворот, вы запросто можете не успеть их применить, больше приходится не считывать действия врагов по движениям, а просто предугадывать. И хотя позже вы уже разживётесь ХП, сражения удовольствия не приносят, а в случае боя с несколькими сильными противниками одновременно так и вовсе становятся пыткой: даже если за всем следить, выучить тайминги и стараться быть максимально аккуратным и эффективным, будет такое странное ощущение... Вот, в какой-нибудь другой игре с неплохой боёвкой каждую битву можно было бы сравнить с танцем. А здесь это чувствуется как встреча инвалидов, как попытка персонажей с серьёзными проблемами в области координации движений и дикими компульсиями поиграть в теннис. Изредка, однако, враги оказываются поумнее, если так можно выразиться, и вместо того, чтобы позориться, просто бегают, не пытаясь вас ударить. К счастью, в игре явно сделан акцент на небоевую составляющую, можно пробегать мимо большинства врагов.
Так что если хорошие бои для вас важны в приключенческой игре, то возможно вам не стоит играть в Hob. В противном случае, можно и потерпеть, ведь мир игры и головоломки поистине радуют, а потому и обзор положительный.

183783192.review: super world building with unique style. it's combine good puzzle + and great action exploring genre. really recommended if you like puzzle game!

183651466.review:
TL:DR: I recommend this game for... the mood. 

Positives:

The game has an okay story, but the biggest appeal of it that YOU have to piece it together from contextual clues and some special rooms with some graphics. There are no voice lines and there is no dialogue which is fine, until you get to the end. 

Exploration is fun and throughout the game you feel like you are re-activating an ancient, forgotten machine which is really cool. The presentation is really nice, combat flows well, upgrades are okay and (for the most part) easy to find. Exploring places, climbing and interacting with the world is the highlight of the game. 

You go through various areas that each have a few set-pieces so I wasn't confused where I was coupled with a decent map (beautiful looking too).  

Th aesthetic of this game intertwines with the atmosphere it builds in such a unique and beautiful way and is honestly the highest point of Hob. There are certain places that you find where you press a button and just sit and enjoy the view which fits this game. 

Negatives: 

I had a few crashes and once I had to re-install the game but that didn't turn me off. 

My biggest gripe with this game is that it's *fine*. It doesn't excel at anything but it doesn't suck at anything (only some jumps and a section in a dungeon where you just have to wait on a hovering platform instead of a baited jump on ledge with a robot). I just play it until I say "Oh, I don't need to play this anymore." and quit. It lacks that thing that would make me hooked to it and want to continue playing it right away. 

Combat is competent but not outstanding. Which is sad because a good part of the game revolves around combat. Hob is at it's best when you solve environment puzzles, platform and interact with stuff around you. I do not remember more than two combat encounters (except the final fight) since most of it was extremely same-y. If combat was thinned down I wouldn't even notice. 

Another major problem is that if this game is played with large breaks you will forget what you have to do and you will have to fiddle around aimlessly for a good while before everything kinda comes back to you. 

All in all I would recommend this game for its atmosphere and unique presentation. It's not a difficult game, and it can be played exclusively for the "vibes". The relaxing atmosphere coupled with a laid-back gameplay and a competent combat system, make it a good candidate for a game that you can play just to decompress.
